newsitem.title: USA: CME traders say USDA data bullish for pork bellies.
newsitem.headline: CME traders say USDA data bullish for pork bellies.

text.p: CME traders said the U.S. Department of Agriculture's monthly cold storage report was very bullish for pork belly futures and the key February contract should be bid the two cent limit up on Monday.
The report put frozen pork belly stocks, as of July 31, at 28.533 million lbs, much lower than expected.
A Reuter survey of analysts had produced estimates from 35.1 million to 38.7 million.
"This report shows huge usage (by the fast food industry)," said independent pork belly futures trader John Textor.
